definition: to make the sign of the cross/to make a cross (on paper)
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: He crossed himself as he passed the church.
sentences.chinese: 他经过教堂时用手在胸前画十字。

sentences.english: The old man crossed himself as he entered the church.
sentences.chinese: 老人进入教堂时用手在胸前画十字。

sentences.english: At Seville every man paid her some bold compliment on her appearance.
sentences.chinese: 在我的家乡，看见这样打扮的女人就要画十字。

sentences.english: Crossing the heart goes back to the Christian tradition of crossing oneself, which still exists in the Roman Catholic and Orthodox churches.
sentences.chinese: 在胸口画十字着一手势可追溯到画十字这一宗教传统。

sentences.english: Crossing the heart goes back to the Christian tradition of crossing oneself, which still exists in the Roman Catholic and Orthodox churches.
sentences.chinese: 在胸口画十字着一手势可追溯到画十字这一宗教传统。

sentences.english: Each person made the sign of the cross as they entered the church.
sentences.chinese: 每个人在进教堂时都会用手画十字。

sentences.english: The lawyer wanted the illiterate man to make His cross on the contract.
sentences.chinese: 律师要这不识字的人在契约上画十字以代替签名。

sentences.english: Americans cross their hearts to seal promises or pledges.
sentences.chinese: 美国人在胸口画十字为了表示一定会实现诺言或誓言。

definition: to draw a rectangular grid (e.g. of farmland)/to checker
to sell at a 50% discount/to fold in two
